entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 30 at 3:59PM AKDT until July 02 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT SATURDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY... * Winds...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Timing...Hot, dry, and windy conditions are expected this afternoon and evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS AND NEAR RECORD WARM TEMPERATURES TO PERSIST INTO MID-NEXT WEEK... Near persistent warm temperatures in higher elevations will continue to cause snow and ice melt into rivers of Upper Lynn Canal including the Taiya, the Skagway, and the Klehini Rivers. This has caused high water levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY THIS LATE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend with highs in the upper 70s into the 80s for the inner channels. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Starting Sunday and continuing through the first half of the week,

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.
